Li-ion conductivity data for the samples were obtained by collecting the electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) spectra following the procedure reported in ref ( 10). The EIS measurements were performed using an HP4192A LF impedance analyzer and a Novocontrol (BDS 1200) sample cell in the temperature range of 20 < T < 130 °C (every 10 °C). By using an axial hydraulic press (60 MPa), the mixtures were pelletized, with a diameter of 10 mm and a thickness of about 0.2–0.6 mm. Impedance data were analyzed via the EqC software
35 following the data validation described in ref ( 36). All fits performed resulted in a χ-squared test (χ 2 test) < 10 –3.
